title: How to Rescue Stale Hard Cheese

steps.headline: Scrape off any mould that has grown on the cheese.
Dip a clean cloth into a solution of strongly salted water.
Wipe the cloth over the cheese.
Allow the cheese to air dry.
Return the cheese to a clean container for continued storage.
steps.description: Place in the refrigerator. The salt will prevent the growth of any more mould.

steps.headline: If you find that this doesn't work, and the cheese is still hard after removing the mold and wiping it down, it can still be used as follows:
steps.description: Allow the cheese to dry thoroughly. Grate the cheese finely. Use the grated cheese in cooking. It can be refrigerated or frozen until needed.
